conversation.speaker: nova
conversation.text: The Five Whys is a powerful questioning technique to explore people's motivations and assumptions. Its primary goal? To uncover the core reasons and beliefs that drive a person's preferences and behaviours. How? Repetitively asking 'Why?' to dig into the logic and rationale behind views. Imagine I'm engaging with potential customers to understand their needs for a new coffee shop in town. Let's walk through an example set of Five Whys questions: First, 'Why would you visit a new coffee shop?' Imagine a customer responding, ...
